title: Was there an experiment on Mythbusters that got them in legal trouble? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: They lobbed a cannon ball over a hill into someones house. Then there was the time that they blew out a bunch of windows due to an explosion. Neither one of those resulted in lawsuits that I could find, largely because they immediately admitted fault and paid to have the damages repaired. They had a few legal squabbles over the name “MythBusters” in various countries, all dismissed as far as I can see. Then there is some guy on the internet saying that the MythBusters stole content from him, and Discovery pulled multiple episodes because of it. I cannot find any substantiation of these claims ,and it looks like the issue was never taken to court. Most of the info I can find on the subject traces back to the Huffington Post, not exactly a bastion if integrity, so unless I see more solid evidence I am going to chalk it up to an inflated ego that got mad because the Mythbusters produced similar content.

In one of the myth intro’s Tory carries a prop bomb to a house and knocks on the door; when Karri opens it he throws it in. One of the neighbors thought that it was a real bomb and called the police. The SWAT team pulls up and holds Tory at gun point until the producers sort out the situation.
